author: daxian-dbw
body:
If a *.csproj file is in a project directory, the latest dotnet.exe will use it, instead of the project.json file, to build the project.

The `*.csproj` files udner `vs-csproj` folders are updated to point to the correct file, but still there are problems when opening them in Visual Studio and they need to be further tweaked. I send out this PR first to unblock the CI systems. I will send out another PR once fix the moved `*.csproj` files.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I believe the existing csproj files should be removed. They are editor configurations, which do not belong in the repository.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @andschwa yes we discussed removing `*.csproj` files in our maintainer channel, and decided to just move them instead because people might depend on it to work with powershell code in Visual Studio.

title: [Fix broken CI] Move *.csproj files to PowerShell/src/vs-csproj and PowerShell/test/vs-csproj to avoid confusing the latest dotnet.exe.
